page.title: 06FLEET AIR ARM FIELD GUN CREW
page.content: The men of{H.M.S.Daedalus}Field Gun Crew look strong and mean.They have to pull a field gun over a specified course to represent the relief of Ladysmith,during the Boer War,by a crew of sailors from H.M.S.Powerful who had to march their guns from Durban,South Africa,a distance of 189 miles. The men have to pull the gun up a ramp where they erect a special harness and swing the gun,and themselves,over a "chasm" onto another ramp.They dismantle the gun,push all the pieces through a gap in the wall, put the gun back together again and then fire it three times.When the men are pulling the gun you can tell that it is heavy because they go red in the face and grit their teeth.They all look well-muscled and powerful.
